thread.title: Lava X41+ with 5-inch HD display, selfie flash and VoLTE launched for Rs 8,999
thread.title_full: Lava X41+ with 5-inch HD display, selfie flash and VoLTE launched for Rs 8,999

title: Lava X41+ with 5-inch HD display, selfie flash and VoLTE launched for Rs 8,999
text:
Lava X41+ with 5-inch HD display, selfie flash and VoLTE launched for... Lava X41+ with 5-inch HD display, selfie flash and VoLTE launched for Rs 8,999 By January 30, 2017 “The X41+ features 2GB of RAM, 32GB of storage, 8MP/5MP cameras and a 2,500mAh battery” 
Lava recently launched the A50 and A55 entry-level Android phones featuring a front-facing LED flash. Now the company has quietly launched yet another device with selfie flash called the X41+. It is a VoLTE-enabled offering that boots Android Marshmallow and supports gestures. The touch-free air gestures allow you to open apps by hovering your hand above the display. 
The Lava X41+ features a 5-inch HD IPS display with a layer of 2.5D curved Gorilla Glass 2 on top. The phone is powered by a 1.3GHz quad-core processor of unknown make, coupled with 2GB of RAM. It comes with 32GB of internal memory, further expandable by another 32GB using a microSD card. 
The X41+ sports an 8-megapixel primary camera and a 5-megapixel secondary shooter, both accompanied by LED flash. Its connectivity options include 4G, VoLTE, dual-SIM slots, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth and GPS. The phone is backed by a 2,500mAh battery, which delivers up to 54.41 hours of talk time. 
The Lava X41+ also comes with support for 11 Indian languages. The phone has been priced at Rs 8,999, and is expected to go on sale across channels in the country soon.
